text: Sega Bass Fishing 2 is a video game developed by WOW Entertainment and published by Sega for the Dreamcast. It is the sequel to Sega Bass Fishing. ==Gameplay== Sega Bass Fishing 2 is a fishing video game. While it can be played with the standard Dreamcast controller, it was designed to support the console's Fishing Controller. The game is single-player. ==Development== Sega Bass Fishing 2 was developed as a sequel to Sega Bass Fishing. Originally an arcade game, its Dreamcast port in 1999 had been unexpectedly successful. ==Reception== Sega Bass Fishing 2 received generally favorable reviews, according to Metacritic. Eric Bratcher reviewed the game for Next Generation, and stated, "More realistic, but not more fun. This is easily Sega's deepest fishing title, but it's alternately too hard or too easy." Edge concurred, citing the game's emphasis on simulation over arcade elements as a downside, compared to the arcade style of the first one. Conversely, GameSpot lauded the game as "a model example of what sequels should be." ===Other reviews=== *GameSpy - Nov 08, 2001 *IGN - Aug 29, 2001 *Power Unlimited - Nov, 2001 ==See also== *Sega Marine Fishing ==References== ==External links== * Category:2001 video games Category:Dreamcast games Category:Dreamcast-only games Category:Fishing video games Category:Sega video games Category:Video games developed in Japan
title: Sega Bass Fishing 2
